In this course, we will explore those ideas, taking the institutions around us not as fixed and unquestionable, but as things to evaluate and, if necessary, to change.
3569.name: Revolutionary Ideas: An Introduction to Legal and Political Philosophy (Alumni)

1542.short_description: Learn to address Information and Communication Technology (ICT) accessibility in this course covering challenges and strategies for organizations and individuals.  Whether corporate, governmental, or nonprofit, this course will enable you to identify ICT accessibility issues, analyze needs, and evaluate solutions for both employees and customers with disabilities.
1542.name: Information and Communication Technology (ICT) Accessibility

1562.short_description: What happens when creativity and science come together?  The power to design our world is unleashed, providing tools to inform choices about how we live!  Geodesign is the glue—it’s a process that deploys creativity to connect information to people, using collaboration to better inform how we design our world.
1562.name: Geodesign: Change Your World

1565.short_description: The United States criminal justice system is typically an accurate and efficient system—although, as a human creation, it is not perfect. This course will employ a social scientific perspective to understand why innocent people are sometimes convicted of crimes they did not commit. In this course we will discuss wrongful convictions, their causes, and their solutions.
1565.name: Presumed Innocent? The Social Science of Wrongful Conviction

1566.short_description: This course is a short introduction to the rich and distinctive world of Australian literature, a world of ancient and modern forms of writing about a vast and varied continent. Explore the work of writers who have responded imaginatively to the unique landscapes of Australia and to its remarkable human history.
1566.name: Australian literature: a rough guide

1572.short_description: Learn how the revolution in geospatial technology combined with the tradecraft of Geospatial Intelligence (GEOINT) have changed how we develop insights about how humans use geography, and discover the power of GEOINT.
1572.name: Geospatial Intelligence & the Geospatial Revolution

1573.short_description: Learn how to apply patterns and frameworks to alleviate the complexity of developing concurrent and networked software. Students will write concurrent and networked software programs in popular open-source pattern-oriented software architecture frameworks, such as Android (Java) and ACE (C++).
1573.name: Pattern-Oriented Software Architectures for Concurrent and Networked Software

1585.short_description: This Final Project course is only available to learners who have earned a Verified Certificate in each course of the Challenges in Global Affairs Specialization (The Changing Global Order, Configuring the World, and International Organizations Management). You won't be able to enroll in this course if you do not have a Verified Certificate in each of those three courses.
1585.name: Global Affairs Final Project

1613.short_description: In this course students will explore the history of Jews, Christians, and Muslims in late medieval, fifteenth century Spain. Serving as citizen-scholars, students will learn about the positive and negative elements of inter-religious co-existence in Plasencia, Spain, and more importantly, contribute to an international scholarly effort by helping transcribe manuscripts.
1613.name: Deciphering Secrets: Unlocking the Manuscripts of Medieval Spain

3663.short_description: Develop expertise in basic magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) physics and principles and gain knowledge of many different data acquisition strategies in MRI
3663.name: MRI Fundamentals

1624.short_description: Curso de actualización docente que tiene como objetivo fortalecer el liderazgo en gestión educativa estratégica a través del uso de la tecnología en los procesos de planeación estratégica, liderazgo compartido, trabajo colaborativo, participación social responsable y evaluación para la mejora continua.
1624.name: Liderazgo en gestión educativa estratégica a través del uso de la tecnología

1639.short_description: This Capstone MOOC gives Signature Track students who passed all previous MOOCs in the MoCCA Specialization “with Distinction” an opportunity to integrate and demonstrate the knowledge they've acquired across the three earlier content area MOOCs.
1639.name: Android Capstone Project

1647.short_description: 本课程针对普通人普及常见的急救和自救的知识和技能，让学习者可以在危急时刻进行急救，或许不够规范甚至不能完成治疗，但能起基础的救护作用，至少能争取救助的时间，从而增加自己、家人或其他人的生存机会。这些应该全民普及的急救技能不仅反映了公民素质，更表现了对生命的尊重和热爱，是尊重生存权的体现。
1647.name: 关爱生命--实用急救与自救技能

1648.short_description: This course is geared towards starting undergraduate students. A solid background in biology will be helpful but not absolutely essential. The material will be of interest to those who are pursuing a career in any of the life sciences as well as anyone who has run up against their biological clock.
1648.name: Circadian clocks: how rhythms structure life

1664.short_description: The course extends the fundamental tools in "Machine Learning Foundations" to powerful and practical models by three directions, which includes embedding numerous features, combining predictive features, and distilling hidden features. [這門課將先前「機器學習基石」課程中所學的基礎工具往三個方向延伸為強大而實用的工具。這三個方向包括嵌入大量的特徵、融合預測性的特徵、與萃取潛藏的特徵。]
1664.name: 機器學習技法 (Machine Learning Techniques)

1678.short_description: Learn about college life and develop strategies to help you be successful during your undergraduate experience.
1678.name: How to Succeed in College

1680.short_description: 《紅樓夢》不只是一部青春紀事，更是一闋母神的頌歌；它既熱烈地宣揚了少女之美，卻也莊嚴地禮讚著母性力量。本次課程將聚焦在女媧─警幻─賈母─元妃─王夫人─劉姥姥六位成熟女性，針對其在書中扮演角色的功能與位置，進行深入的剖析，重新辨明這些「母神」具備的崇高形象。
1680.name: 紅樓夢二──母神崇拜(The Red Chamber Dream 2)

1696.short_description: Knowledge linking genomics to health and disease is rapidly expanding.  Translation of this knowledge into clinical and public health practice offers promising opportunities but also raises a host of ethical, legal, social, and policy questions.  Using case examples, this inter-disciplinary course will explore the challenges of genomic and precision medicine.
1696.name: Ethical and Social Challenges of Genomic and Precision Medicine

1720.short_description: In this course, we explore what it means to be a leader in the context of healthcare. How is it different to leadership in other industries?  What are the particular skills and attitudes leaders need to have to navigate the complexity of healthcare leadership?
1720.name: Health Leadership

1733.short_description: Ce cours présente les principaux courants qui marquent aujourd'hui la réflexion éthique et touchent tout un chacun dans sa vie personnelle, sociale et citoyenne. D’Aristote à Kant, de Bentham à Derrida, à travers un voyage philosophique passionnant nous entrerons dans le vif du débat éthique contemporain.
1733.name: Le Bien, le Juste, l'Utile. Introduction aux éthiques philosophiques

2337.short_description: Learn the key facets of cost analysis. Topics will include types of costs, cost behavior, costing system design, activity-based costing, and cost-volume-profit analysis.
2337.name: Managerial Accounting: Cost Behaviors, Systems, and Analysis

2377.short_description: Designing technologies that facilitate learning. Beyond usability, technology for learning has to engage, trigger prior knowledge, prompt for reflection, maintain a balance between too much cognitive load and too little challenge, and scaffold the development of skills.
2377.name: Designing Technology for Learning

2683.short_description: Learn about and explore tools to incorporate Common Core literacy standards into your content area. In this course you will explore Literacy Design Collaborative resources, and develop a plan to use one of those resources within your context.
2683.name: Common Core in Action II: Exploring Literacy Design Collaborative Tools

1767.short_description: Questions related to sexuality and reproduction are intimately linked to health, well-being and human rights. In this course, you will gain a unique opportunity to explore the field of SRHR together with participants from around the world, and to reflect upon themes and issues that are of global relevance.
1767.name: Global Perspectives on Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights (SRHR)

1774.short_description: This course presents the concepts and processes of quality improvement (QI) and the importance of QI in improving patient outcomes.  Its aim is to enhance the competence of working healthcare professionals to lead and participate in interprofessional healthcare teams that are focused on quality improvement.
1774.name: Take the Lead on Healthcare Quality Improvement

1775.short_description: Applications of computer graphics are ubiquitous, ranging from animations in movies to computer aided design of mechanical parts. In this course, we will learn how to create three-dimensional  interactive applications using WebGL that run within the latest web browsers. We will disucss all aspects of computer graphics from hardware to software to applications.
1775.name: Interactive Computer Graphics with WebGL

2687.short_description:
Introduire aux problématiques contemporaines du droit international et du droit comparé.

An Introduction to the contemporary issues on international law and comparative law.
2687.name: Droit international et droit comparé: regards croisés

1800.short_description: As the baby boomer generation ages, the impacts of alcohol and drug use among this generation will become an increasingly important public health issue. This 5-week course will provide primary care givers and health care providers with an overview of this looming issue and provide strategies for the prevention and reduction of substance use associated harm.
1800.name: Alcohol, Drugs, and Baby Boomers: Are you ready?

1807.short_description: Le cours présente les cellules solaires à base de silicium, depuis la physique des semiconducteurs cristallins jusqu’au fonctionnement des modules photovoltaïques. Les semiconducteurs désordonnés utilisés dans les cellules en couche mince sont également traités. Les aspects socio-économiques et environnementaux du photovoltaïque sont abordés.
1807.name: Physique des cellules solaires au silicium

1827.short_description:
This course was previously called: The Magna Carta and its Legacy.

This course aims to lead students into a greater appreciation for and an understanding of Magna Carta and its significance around the globe, as we approach the 800th anniversary of its sealing. The course examines why Magna Carta was radical in its day, why it has been a source of numerous debates, and why this anniversary is being celebrated in the present.
1827.name: Freedom and protest: Magna Carta and its legacies

1830.short_description: 本课程针对医学图像的特征，结合临床需求，由浅入深地讲解医学图像的种类、特征、应用领域、数字化存储形式，并分类讲解图像处理的理论和算法，结合应用案例和课程实践使学生熟练掌握祥光领域的知识和技能，并具备一定的动手能力。
1830.name: 医学图像处理技术 Medical Image Analysis

1838.short_description: Explore the fundamentals of the Global Positioning System (GPS) and how it works by conducting "backyard" laboratory experiments on your own mobile device. Learn the basics of satellite navigation and witness the power of a network with planet-wide coverage. Gain a deeper understanding of GPS and its role in our lives, while interacting with a worldwide community of learners and backyard scientists.
1838.name: GPS: An Introduction to Satellite Navigation, with an interactive Worldwide Laboratory using Smartphones

1870.short_description: Learn about acoustics by using the concept of impedance. Following part 1, radiation, scattering, and diffraction are studied. Wave propagation in closed space is also covered. Leads to understand essentials as well to cover graduate level topics.
1870.name: Introduction to Acoustics (Part 2)

1905.short_description: An 11-lesson course teaching a comprehensive overview of analytical theory pertaining to video game media. Topics covered: play and game, emergence versus progression, game mechanics, story, interpretive theory, the culture of games, violence, sex and race in games, and finally, serious games. Estimated workload: 3-5 hrs/wk for non-credit; 7-10 hrs/wk for credit.
1905.name: Understanding Video Games

1948.short_description:
This is a 6 week course covering the first part of AP* Calculus which includes limits, derivatives and applications.

* AP Calculus is a registered trademark of the College Board, which was not involved in the production of, and does not endorse, this product.
1948.name: Preparing for the AP* Calculus AB and BC Exams (Part 1 - Differential Calculus)

1953.short_description: This course provides an overview of climate change adaptation for the Small Island Developing States (SIDS) with a focus on the environmental perspective. It will present the key concepts regarding the issues of adaptation to climate change and the methodological tools needed to analyse challenges faced by SIDS, in order to propose sustainable solutions.
1953.name: Pathways to climate change adaptation: the case of Small Island Developing States

1961.short_description: 靜電靜磁到電磁波相關物理、數學及應用之介紹
1961.name: 電磁學(Electromagnetics)

1966.short_description: All your questions answered in seven exciting episodes!
1966.name: Latino Popular Culture for the Clueless

1973.short_description: This is an intensive, advanced summer school (in the sense used by scientists) in some of the methods of computational, data-intensive science.  It covers a variety of topics from applied computer science and engineering, and statistics, and it requires a strong background in computing, statistics, and data-intensive research.
1973.name: The Caltech-JPL Summer School on Big Data Analytics

1974.short_description: 本课程旨在加深学员对中国历史与古代社会生活的认识；促进对传统文化核心观点与基本精神的理解与把握；培养文化研究初步方法。
1974.name: 中国古代文化

1975.short_description: This course exposes students to the logic of statistical reasoning and its application in the quantitative social sciences. It is meant as a thorough but accessible introduction to the topics of descriptive statistics, probability theory, and statistical inference with hands-on exercises.
1975.name: Introduction to Statistics for the Social Sciences

1980.short_description: This course provides an introduction to basic financial planning topics and is targeted towards young adults. General topics include financial goal setting, saving and investing, budgeting, financial risk, borrowing, and credit. In addition, the course includes content which introduces students to career opportunities in financial planning.
1980.name: Financial Planning for Young Adults

1986.short_description: An immersive experience in the world of sports that will take students through the four stages of the professional athlete's career. Utilizing lectures, guest speakers and hypothetical walkthroughs, students will learn how the best sports agents manage each of these four stages.
1986.name: Representing the Professional Athlete

2001.short_description: 本课面向有志于学术研究和具有论文写作需求的高年级本科生和研究生同学，适合人文社会科学、特别是法学专业的学生学习，也欢迎理工科学生选修。教学内容主要集中于学术研究的基本方法与一般理念，既包括学术论文的提问、选题、谋篇、布局和实际写作，也包括学术资源特别是综合性与专业性数据库的检索和使用。
2001.name: 论文写作与检索（Academic Writing and Research）

2011.short_description: 基于20世纪西方音乐，什么是音乐、什么是20世纪西方音乐及什么是有效聆听为全课核心线索，引导学生发展美感能力，促进其全面聆听能力的培养。The course aims to provide a clear view of the historical development of music and emphasizes the training of aural skills.
2011.name: 20世纪西方音乐 Western Music in the 20th Century

2028.short_description: This course will provide learners with an opportunity to explore the challenges, opportunities, and skills necessary to provide nursing care in rural areas.
2028.name: Rural Health Nursing

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade consists of equally-weighted electronic quizzes (20% of the final grade), a midterm exam (15% of the final grade), a final exam (25% of the final grade, and four programming assignments (weighted 8%, 8%, 12%, 12% from first to last).  Over the length of the course, the student was required to write a compiler for a strongly-typed, object-oriented language.  A total of 2.5% extra credit was available for completing the DeduceIt programming problems (each problem weighted equally). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you must have obtained 70% or more of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: The content of this course on programming language compilers included lexical analysis, parsing, syntax-directed translation, abstract syntax trees, types and type checking, intermediate languages, dataflow analysis, program optimization, code generation and runtime systems.

courses.grading_policy_normal:
Your final grade was calculated as the higher of these two options:
1. The average of all quiz points.  In order to get a Statement of Accomplishment, you had to have gotten greater than 90% of the maximum possible grade.

2. Dropping the lowest quiz, the percentage of quizzes for which your grade was greater than 90%.  In order to get a Statement of Accomplishment, you had to have achieved > 90% on no fewer than 10 quizzes.

courses.certificate_description: This course will explore new breakthroughs in the treatment of patients during cardiac arrest and after successful resuscitation, including new approaches to cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and post-arrest care.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
The course will consist of weekly video lectures, with each week accompanied by a Completion Quiz.  Grading for this course will be based solely on the Completion Quizzes. Your highest score for each quiz will be recorded.

Statements of Accomplishment will be awarded by Coursera to all students registering an aggregate score of 80% or better. Please note that your lowest-scored quiz in the course will be omitted from your aggregate score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Every week, students will be completing one to three quizzes worth between 5 and 10 points, as well as a problem set worth 20 points.  Three case studies will be due every few weeks (30 pts each).  A final exam, worth 40 points, will be given in the last week.  The total points in the class will be 350, roughly 17% quizzes, 46% problem sets, 26% case studies and a final worth 11%.  Extra credit points may be awarded for posting or highly active board participation.  To earn a certificate with distinction students must get 85%% of the total course points.
courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course covered a half-semester of a standard instrumental analysis course and included such topics as chromatography, atomic and infrared spectroscopy, calibrations and linear regression, and electrochemical sensors.

textbooks.description: Known for its readability and systematic, rigorous approach, this fully updated Ninth Edition of FUNDAMENTALS OF ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY offers extensive coverage of the principles and practices of analytic chemistry and consistently shows students its applied nature. The book's award-winning authors begin each chapter with a story and photo of how analytic chemistry is applied in industry, medicine, and all the sciences. To further reinforce student learning, a wealth of dynamic photographs by renowned chemistry photographer Charlie Winters appear as chapter-openers and throughout the text. Incorporating Excel spreadsheets as a problem-solving tool, the Ninth Edition is enhanced by a chapter on Using Spreadsheets in Analytical Chemistry, updated spreadsheet summaries and problems, an "Excel Shortcut Keystrokes for the PC" insert card, and a supplement by the text authors, EXCEL APPLICATIONS FOR ANALYTICAL CHEMISTRY, which integrates this important aspect of the study of analytical chemistry into the book's already rich pedagogy. New to this edition is OWL, an online homework and assessment tool that includes the Cengage YouBook, a fully customizable and interactive eBook, which enhances conceptual understanding through hands-on integrated multimedia interactivity.   Available with InfoTrac Student Collections http://gocengage.com/infotrac.
textbooks.authors: Skoog, Douglas A.|Skoog|West, Donald M.|Holler|Holler, F. James|Crouch|Crouch, Stanley R.
textbooks.name: Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry

courses.grading_policy_normal:
Every week, students will be completing one to three quizzes worth between 5 and 10 points, as well as a problem set worth 20 points.  Three case studies will be due every few weeks (30 pts each).  A final exam, worth 40 points, will be given in the last week.  The total points in the class will be 350, roughly 17% quizzes, 46% problem sets, 26% case studies and a final worth 11%.  Extra credit points may be awarded for posting or highly active board participation as well as extra assignments.  These points will be added onto the base number of points at the end, up to a total of 30 points.  

To earn a certificate students must get 70% of the total course points and to get a certificate with distinction they should earn 85% of the total course points.
The final grade will be based on 8 assignments, completion of 16 quizzes, and one case study activity.
The final grade will be based on 8 assignments, completion of 16 quizzes, and one case study activity.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: To receive a statement of accomplishment with distinction, students must obtain more than 80% of the total course points.  This can be accomplished by good performance on weekly quizzes and a final exam, and the completion of four additional in-depth quizzes plus a project-based peer-graded assignment during week 3.
courses.certificate_description: Nanotechnology: The Basics is an introductory course that describes how the small size and unique properties of nanoscale materials can be applied in electronics, magnetics and photonics.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
To get a statement of accomplishment, students must obtain more than 40% of the total points in the class. These will be derived from four quizzes (80% of the grade) and one final exam (20% of the grade).

To receive a statement of accomplishment with distinction, students must obtain more than 80% of the total basic plus in-depth points in the class. In addition to the basic assignments, students will also be expected to complete four in-depth quizzes and complete the project-based peer-graded assignment during week 3

Regardless of track, students are given two weeks to complete every assignment after posting.  Also the late policy provides students with 8 days to apply as needed.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
The "Awareness Level" of the course gave an overview of the topic and required viewing of nominated videos and application related features, and answering a questionnaire on their contents. The pass level was 37% or more.

The "Foundation Level" reflected the core taught material on the course and gave a grounding in AI planning technology and algorithms. It required an acceptable score on awareness and foundation level exams. The pass level was 60% or more.

The "Performance Level" of the course was for those interested in carrying out additional programming assignments and engaging in creative challenges to understand the subject more deeply. It required an acceptable score on awareness and foundation level exams and on performance level assignments, which required writing code, running an AI planner and/or creating a digital artifact. The pass level was 75% or more. The Statement of Achievement marked as "With Distinction" is used for passes at the Performance Level of the course.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade was calculated as 50% of quizzes (dropping the lowest quiz score) and 50% of MP1 - MP5 (dropping the lowest MP). In addition, MP6 is calculated as extra credit. Within the quiz category, all included quizzes are weighted equally. Within the MP category, all included MPs are also weighted equally. To receive a Statement of Distinction, one has to obtain >=85% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: The course covers data parallel execution models, locality, parallel algorithm patterns, and scalable programming using joint MPI-CUDA in large scale computing clusters. As part of the course work, students were required to complete 5 quizzes and 5 programming assignments.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was calculated as 50% of quizzes (dropping the lowest quiz score) and 50% of MP1 - MP5 (dropping the lowest MP). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, one has to obtain >=70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade was calculated as 50% quizzes and 50% MPs. courses.certificate_description: This course surveys the fundamental CAD algorithms and data structures used to build modern VLSI chips, and covers essential synthesis and verification methods for VLSI logic and layout design.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The course comprises 8 Problem Sets, 4 Programming Assignments and 1 Final Exam.  For a Statement of Accomplishment with Achievement Badge, students must achieve ~70% of the maximum possible score, across the Problem Sets (75% of final grade) and Final Exam (25% of final grade).  For a Statement of Accomplishment with Mastery Badge, students must achieve ~70% of the maximum possible score, across the Problem Sets (40% of final grade), Programming Assignments (40% of final grade) and Final Exam (20% of final grade).

courses.certificate_description: This course is a novice-friendly introduction to computer science and programming Android apps for smartphones and tablets. In it, students use the programming tools that Android software developers use and build a complete and useful app during this course.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
A minimum score of 70% was required in order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment. This score was comprised of the following:

* 60% of your track score comes from the first 5 weekly quizzes.
* 40% of your track score comes from the first 2 projects.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade was based on your best 5 of 7 quizzes (10% of the final grade), best 3 of 4 homework assignments (25% of the final grade), best 2 of 3 programming/analysis assignments (25% of the final grade) and all of the final exam (40% of the final grade). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you need to have obtained >= 80% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: This course is about building `web-intelligence' applications exploiting big data sources arising social media, mobile devices and sensors, using new big-data platforms based on the 'map-reduce' parallel programming paradigm.

courses.certificate_description: This 8-week graduate-level course teaches scientists to become more effective writers, using practical examples and exercises. Topics: principles of good writing, tricks for writing faster, the format of a scientific manuscript, and issues in publication and peer review.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
Quizzes (5 x 10 = 50 points) 
The first five weeks each have a 10-point quiz.  The purpose of the quizzes is to assess your knowledge and skills gained by study of the mini-lecture and the interactive modules.  You may refer to your learning notes and the study guides during the quizzes.  There is no time limit and you have an unlimited number of attempts to take each quiz.  After each attempt you will see whether  your answers are correct or incorrect. The quizzes will automatically record your best attempt in the grade book.
You must receive an average of at least 80% or above across all quizzes to access a "Statement of Accomplishment" at the completion of the course. With an average of 90% or above, you will earn a "Statement of Distinction."

courses.grading_policy_distinction: There are two ways to earn a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction. Participants who meet the Statement of Accomplisment criteria for both the quizzes and peer-assessed essays will earn a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction. Additionally, anyone who meets the Statement of Accomplishment critieria through either quiz score or essay may earn a Distinction based on contributions to the Discussion Forum. To earn this requires an average of three posts per week to discussion forums, including threads you create, and at least 8 vote-ups on your posts.
courses.certificate_description: This course examines the U.S. civil rights movement from the vantage point of women, considering both women’s involvement in the legal campaigns and political protests and the impact of civil rights struggles on women’s status and identity.
courses.grading_policy_normal: There are two ways to earn a Statement of Accomplishment: through the weekly quizzes or through the peer-graded short essays. The first way is through weekly quizzes based on the videos and required reading. There are 12 weekly quizzes, each worth 20 points. Based on the 8 highest quiz scores, participants who earn 112 points or more will earn a Statement of Accomplishment. The second way to earn this is through peer-assessed essays. There are four peer-assessed essays in the course; participants who submit all four essays and peer evaluations for all four will earn a Statement of Accomplishment if they achieve an average score of 5.4 (on a 9 point scale) on their top three essays.

courses.certificate_description: This course provides an introduction into the law of the EU: the creation and development of the EU including its institutional structure and functioning,  how EU law impacts on the lives of EU citizens as well as on companies and Europe’s common currency crisis.

textbooks.description: With a readable and modern writing style, EU Law Directions clearly explains the key topics and developments in this fast-paced and increasingly important subject area. No previous knowledge is assumed, making this the idea text for those approaching EU law for the first time. With nearly 30 years' experience teaching and examining EU law, Nigel Foster provides a student-friendly text which is readable without compromising on academic quality. The text is easy-to-follow with useful features throughout such as case summaries, key definitions and diagrams. Cross-references and end of chapter summaries demonstrate how topics link together and enable students to quickly build up a comprehensive understanding of EU Law. The text is clearly broken down into logical sections, guiding students through institutional, procedural and substantive law while considering the law from a European as well as a UK perspective.This text is also accompanied by a free online resource centre (www.oxfordtextbooks.co.uk/orc/foster_directions3e/) which includes the following features: - An interactive timeline showing the key moments in EU legal history- An interactive map illustrating the development of the EU and providing essential background knowledge- Video clips from the European Commission - Suggested approaches to end of chapter questions- Study and exam tips- Updates to the law- Useful weblinksThere is also a selection of resources for lecturers, including an additional chapter on competition law and a customisable testbank.
textbooks.name: EU Law Directions

textbooks.description: Andrea Lunsford’s research shows that students are writing more than ever — in classrooms, workplaces, and social spaces, in local communities and around the world. The Everyday Writer, Fifth Edition, is the first tabbed handbook to help the participants in this "literacy revolution" build on the smart decisions they make as social writers — and use their skills in their academic and professional work. With Andrea Lunsford’s trademark attention to rhetorical choice and language, and with new chapters on public writing, critical reading, and understanding how and why to use documentation, The Everyday Writer gives today’s students the information they need to be effective, ethical writers. New illustrations by graphic artist G.B. Tran make complicated concepts clear and inviting for students.
textbooks.name: The Everyday Writer

courses.certificate_description:
本課程以崑曲的歷史文化、文學、音樂、表演、美學為核心主題，透過學者與表演藝術家的解說示範，提昇學生對中國傳統文化、古典文學與表演藝術之鑑賞能力。
學生透過本科的學習，可以 :
(1) 增進對中國歷史及其文化瑰寶「崑曲」的認識
(2) 加深對中國古典文學、美學與表演藝術之鑑賞能力
(3) 加深對中國人文精神的感知
(4) 增加學生文化素養，對個人及社會的感悟

courses.grading_policy_normal:
Your final grade was calculated as the sum of your scores on the fifteen reading quizzes and the fifteen forum activities, each of which was worth three points. A perfect score in the class was 90 points.

You need to have achieved at least 75 points (83.3% of the total possible) to receive a Statement of Accomplishment. You must also have posted in the forums at least five times.

A detailed explanation of how your grade was calculated follows.

In its grading, Coursera does not provide a simple means for using “AND” statements such as, "You must have received a total score of at least 83.3% and have posted in the forums at least five times." Therefore, the equation I entered into their automated scoring system was,

Whichever is less:

“The sum of your reading quizzes and forum activities, all divided by 90 and multiplied by 100”

OR

“The sum of your posts in the forum (up to five) multiplied by 20.”

The result must have been greater than 83.3.

For example,

1) If your total score on your reading quizzes and forum activities was 90% and you posted in the forums at least five times (100%), your final score will show as 90% and you will receive a Statement of Accomplishment.

2) If your total score on your reading quizzes and forum activities was 90% but you didn't post in the forums at all (0%), your final score will show as 0% and you will not receive a Statement of Accomplishment.

3) If your total score on your reading quizzes and forum activities was 80% and you posted in the forum at least five times (100%), your final score will show as 80% and you will not receive a Statement of Accomplishment.

4) If your total score on your reading quizzes and forum activities was 80% and you didn't post in the forums at all (0%), your final score will show as 0% and you will not receive a Statement of Accomplishment.

Two important notes:

First, I set up all of the forum activity reporting logs such that the possible answers to each question were always "Yes" followed by "No." When I set up the forum activities for Questions 14 and 15, I neglected to uncheck the box that randomizes the answers by default. Thus, when you went to record your forum activities in Week 8, it was possible that "No" may have preceded "Yes," which would have been inconsistent with what you were accustomed to in the previous seven weeks. I decided, therefore, to give all of you full credit (3 points each) for these two forum activities.

Second, I set the minimum number of forum posts required to receive a certificate at five, but in reality it would have been impossible to have achieved 75 of the 90 points possible in the course without having posted in the forum at least seven times. (I am allowing flexibility on two posts.) The explanation is as follows: If a perfect score on all fifteen reading quizzes is assumed (45 points), then a perfect score on ten forum activities (30 points) would still be needed to reach 75 points. Of the fifteen forum activities, there were only three that did not require posting in the forums: Questions 5, 10, and 12. (Posting your answer for the Question 12 forum activity was optional, and the forum activities for Questions 5 and 10 required you to participate in the forum, which technically could have been satisfied by simply voting up or down on posts.)

At the end of the course, there will also be a final quiz which will be graded, and in order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment you will have to obtain >= 70% of the maximal possible score. Our aim is not to test for your expertise in mathematical philosophy, but we want to get you excited about mathematical philosophy and, ideally, to attract some of you to study mathematical philosophy in full depth later on!

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
本課程授課影片中的 video quiz 不會列入成績評量，請大家輕鬆作答。

本課程的成績評量主要是由每一週的作業（weekly quiz，共十次）跟一次的期末考決定，其中作業成績佔 70%，期末考成績佔 30%。另外我們在開課中期，會有多人競技的遊戲平台上線。遊戲的分數將可作為課程加分（最高可加到 20 分）。遊戲的加分多少，將由玩家在遊戲中的「解題數排名」和「佔地數排名」兩者中最佳的名次所決定。遊戲加分後課程成績超過 100 分則以 100 分滿分計。

詳細計算方式如下：

X = 10 次 Quiz 的總成績（正規化為 100 分）, Y = 期末考成績（正規化為 100 分）, Z = 機率線上遊戲之加分, Z = 20*( 1- Min{解題數排名, 佔地數排名}/修課總人數) ,

期末成績為： Min{70%X + 30%Y + Z, 100} 分.

若期末成績超過 85 分者，可得到「傑出修業合格證明」。
courses.certificate_description: 本課程是大學部課程，涵蓋機率的重要理論基礎。另外課程作業亦搭配臺大電機系所開發的多人競技線上遊戲方式，讓同學在遊戲中快速培養同學們對於機率的洞察力與應用能力。

詳細計算方式如下：

X = 10 次 Quiz 的總成績（正規化為 100 分）, Y = 期末考成績（正規化為 100 分）, Z = 機率線上遊戲之加分, Z = 20*( 1- Min{解題數排名, 佔地數排名}/線上遊戲人數) ,

期末成績為： Min{70%X + 30%Y + Z, 100} 分.

若期末成績超過 70 分者，可得到「修業合格證明」。

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Students will earn a Statement of Accomplishment or Verified Certificate with distinction upon timely completion of three required assignments (from Track A or B), one final reflective essay assignment, completing a minimum of twelve assessments (three submissions for each of the four assignments listed above), and scores of at least 80% in both quizzes.
courses.certificate_description: This course approaches the notions of “art” and “history” from the perspective of contemporary artists, animators and gamers, and proposes thinking about the creative process as a “conversation” with a wide range of art from the past.
courses.grading_policy_normal: Students will earn a Statement of Accomplishment or Verified Certificate upon timely completion of at least two required assignments (from Track A or B), one final reflective essay assignment, completing a minimum of nine assessments for the assignments listed above, and scores of at least 70% in both quizzes.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Cette distinction est décernée aux étudiants ayant répondu correctement (score maximal)  et dans les temps à tous les exercices de programmation, le nombre d'essais ne rentrant pas en compte.
courses.certificate_description: Modéliser un problème, concevoir un algorithme de résolution et en proposer une implémentation correcte en Java. Du problème à sa solution, ce cours combine approches pragmatique, pratique et théorique de l'informatique.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Les notes finales ont été calculées en moyennant les 7 meilleures notes obtenues lors des 8 exercices de programmation, chacun étant ramené sur 100.
Pour obtenir le certificat, il faut avoir une note >= 75, le maximum étant 100.

courses.certificate_description: This course covers the legal aspects of entrepreneurship from both a doctrinal and practical perspective, addressing such issues as entity selection, protection of intellectual property, financing a new venture, hiring workers, and conducting business online.

textbooks.description: The updated 4th Edition of THE ENTREPRENEUR'S GUIDE TO BUSINESS LAW takes you through the various stages of starting a business--from start-up and growth to an initial public offering--while highlighting the legal preparations and pitfalls that go along with them. Packed with practical strategies for managing legal issues, the text presents the essentials on leaving your job, competing with a former employer, contract law, and bankruptcy, as well as on the most current issues like clean energy, e-commerce, and the effects of the recent recession on entrepreneurship.
textbooks.authors: Bagley, Constance E.|Bagley, Constance E. (Constance E. Bagley)|Dauchy, Craig E.
textbooks.name: The Entrepreneur's Guide to Business Law

courses.certificate_description: A guide to optimal decision making, improved outcomes of individual patients, and harm reduction through preservation of ecological diversity. Presented by the Division of Infectious Diseases in the Department of Medicine at Stanford University School of Medicine.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
This course is designed as a Continuing Medical Education (CME) course. Clinicians who complete the course have the opportunity to earn CME credit. More detail about this is available within the course. 

Coursera students who successfully complete the class can receive a Statement of Accomplishment. The final grade is based on 1 post-course exam and 1 post-course survey. You must obtain greater than or equal to 75% of the maximum possible score. 

Statements of Accomplishment will be released on the first week of December, February, April, June, August, and October.

courses.certificate_description: Students in this undergraduate-level course gained a deeper understanding of the life and work of the young Albert Einstein, especially his mind-bending special theory of relativity.

courses.certificate_description: Volcanic eruptions are a powerful demonstration of the energy of the Earth's interior. A quantitative physico-chemical description of the nature of lava and magma and the role of experiments in quantifying the eruptive process were covered in this course.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction the final score should be >= 90% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course investigates the basic principles of Early Renaissance Architecture in Italy: from Alberti to Bramante examining problems of the architectural spaces, technology and forms looking to the antiquity in the XV century in Italy.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
This Course offers  8  groups  of 12 multi-choice questions, that will be opened at the end of each week. Each group of multiple-choice questions  is worth  5% of the overall score. You have to answer to each group of questions within 2 weeks since its availability.
If you answer correctly to all the questions, you will get a full grade and each missing answer will be considered incorrect.
A percentage score reduction will be applied depending on the number of wrong answers.
A penalty of 5% will be applied to each test completed after two weeks of its availability and must be done before the final exam. 
The final exam will take place at the end of the 8th week and it will consist of 30 multiple-choice questions. You have 2 weeks to complete it. The final exam is worth 60% of the total score and concludes the course. Students who obtain at least 60% of the overall test score and 51% of the final exam will receive a certificate of successful course completion.
To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 90% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: Crafting an Effective Writer teaches the parts of speech, subjects, verbs, clauses, phrases, punctuation, and the writing process; the course culminates in students writing a developed paragraph.
courses.grading_policy_normal: Grades are calculated based on weighted percentages: Quizzes (in-video & weekly [19 total]): are worth 60% of the final grade, Peer Reviewed Writing Assignments (3 total) are worth 20%, and the Final Paragraph is worth 20%.  The mathematical formula is as follows: [(Q1+Q2+Q3+Q4+Q5+Q6+Q7+Q8+Q9+Q10+Q11+Q12+Q13+Q14+Q15+Q16+Q17+Q18+Q19)*.6] + [(W1+W2+W3)*.2] + [FP*.2]   -- OR -- [(Quiz total points)*.6] + [(Writing total points)*.2] + [(Final paragraph total points)*.2].   To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 80% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: “Comic Books and Graphic Novels” presented a survey of the history of American comics and a review of major graphic novels circulating in the U. S. today. It proposed that comics are literature and argued that art is generative, so there is always hope.

En fin de cours, la somme des notes obtenues lors des exercices a été divisée par le nombre d'exercices à faire (8). Tout étudiant qui a obtenu une moyenne de 55/100 reçoit un certificat pour le cours.

•Your forum contributions across the course (20% for 15 in total).
courses.certificate_description: Why and how are teachers integrating ICT into primary education? In this course we analyse examples from schools in different parts of the world, and bring professional teachers, headteachers and policymakers together to share their best ideas and inspiring stories.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
You will also be asked to review two peer contributions per week from Week 3 onwards, once you have submitted your own contribution. 

Participants will need to score 60% to receive a Verified Certificate

Your final grade will be calculated from:
•Number of peer assessments (20% for 4 in total)
•Number of peer evaluations by you (30% for 2 peer evaluations each week, making 8 in total)
•Your score on the peer assessments (30%, based on your scores for each of the 4 peer assessments you submit for peer evaluation)
•Your forum contributions across the course (20% for 15 in total).

courses.certificate_description: This course provides content demonstrating that sleep is a fundamental biological rhythm, actively generated by the brain. courses.certificate_description: This was a survey course on the principles of Clinical Toxicology. The emphasis was hospital management of poisonings with a case-oriented lecture format. The topics were prioritized by prevalence of human poisoning, natural and synthetic toxins, and target organ effects.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on six weekly quizzes (42% of the final grade), six peer-assessed case-based writing assignments (42% of the final grade), and a comprehensive final examination (16% of the final grade). To pass the course, students had to earn a total grade of 70% or higher.

courses.certificate_description: How Viruses Cause Disease (12 weeks) explores the interplay between viruses and their host organisms, and provides an overview of viral entry into the host, tropism, virulence, transmission, immune defenses, patterns of infection, and control.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The best 11 out of 12 weekly quizzes will be averaged and worth 40% of the final grade. A final exam will be worth 60% of the final grade.

Your final grade will be determined by eight weekly quizzes (no quiz in week 6, instead there is mid-term exam), ten weekly activities, one mid-term exam, and one final exam.  Each assignment is worth points as follows:
Weekly Quizzes = 30 points total 
Weekly Activities = 20 points total
Mid-term Exam = 20 points total
Final Exam = 30 points total
Grades are awarded based on the total points received as follows:
A+ = 97-100 points
A = 94-96 
A- = 90-93 
B+ = 87-89 
B = 84-86 
B- = 80-83 
C+ = 77-79 
C = 74-76 
C- = 70-73 
D+ = 67-69 
D = 65-66 
F = 0-64

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
配分方式：
第一週作業 12 分 
第二週作業 12 分 
第三週作業 17 分 
第四週作業 17 分 
第五週作業 20 分 （期末專題第一部分） 
第六週作業 30 分 （期末專題第二部分） 

評分方式：
作業批改將採互評機制，每份作業將有五人批改，每人也應批改五份作業，若未完成作業批改，該次作業將有20%的分數折減。 

及格標準：
成績加總超過 70 分者，可得到「修業合格證明」。 
成績加總超過 90 分者，可得到「傑出修業合格證明」。
courses.certificate_description: 工程圖學課程目標是培養製圖與讀圖的能力，且同時著重理論與實務。理論方面包含投影、讀圖、剖面、透視、標註等基本的製圖原理，以及各項工程常用的圖像語言。實作方面包含手繪工程圖技巧、電腦輔助繪圖 (CAD) 的技巧。本課程實作四項指定繪圖作業，以及一項實作專題，繪製建築外觀之電腦輔助繪圖。

courses.certificate_description: 工程圖學課程目標是培養製圖與讀圖的能力，且同時著重理論與實務。理論方面包含投影、讀圖、剖面、透視、標註等基本的製圖原理，以及各項工程常用的圖像語言。實作方面包含手繪工程圖技巧、電腦輔助繪圖 (CAD) 的技巧。本課程實作四項指定繪圖作業，以及一項實作專題，繪製建築外觀之電腦輔助繪圖。

courses.certificate_description: 本课以“中国的眼光，现代的立场”来解释中国如何针对世界艺术史进行不同于西方的研究和解说，具体陈述西方艺术与中国艺术理念和创作方法上的区别，进而实验通过艺术史如何建造一条各文明之间互相理解、互相尊重的道路。
courses.grading_policy_normal: 总成绩由计分练习（占总成绩70%）和期末考核（占总成绩30%）组成。我们将给成绩在70分以上的同学颁发电子合格证书。

courses.certificate_description: “数据结构与算法”是计算机学科中的核心基础课程。课程的主要目标培养学生较全面地理解基本数据结构的概念和经典算法的思想及各种实现方法，掌握数据结构和算法的设计分析技术。根据所求解问题的性质选择合理的数据结构并对时间空间复杂性进行必要的控制，提高程序设计的质量。使得学生在将来的学习、研究和工作中，具备设计和实现高效的数据结构和算法的能力。
courses.grading_policy_normal:
评分按照日常作业的完成情况和期中期末考试的答题情况进行。课程参与（10%），测验(quiz)（30%） ，编程作业（20%），期中考试（15%），期末考试（25%）。
POJ作业在程序自动评测网站发布：http://dsalgo.openjudge.cn/
设置“合格”（达到60%成绩）、"优秀"（达到80%成绩）两档课程标准，由任课教师签发北大统一的课程结业证书。

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
本课程的成绩分为5个部分：思考题10%，编程作业50%，期中考试15%，期末考试20%，论坛讨论参与5%

“思考题”多数为问答题，其目的有两个：（1）作为课程内容的延伸，促进学生的进一步独立思考；（2）对课程中所涉及的知识点的掌握程度进行考察；（3）进一步提示大家哪些内容是课程的重点；（4）做一些调研，以获取课程相关的信息。编程作业每次开放7天，截止后还有7天可以提交，但会有每天5%的扣分，再之后提交无效。

“编程作业”是课程考核的重点。本课程绝大部分编程作业都是“在线”编程练习题，即需要各位同学登录 http://ica.openjudge.cn/ 网站，在该网站上，在线提交程序代码，在线即时查看程序执行结果。本课程的编程作业将于课程开始的第三周开始布置，届时，我们会给出提示，请大家要求要求登录上述网站并完成作业。编程作业每次开放7天，截止后还有7天可以提交，但会有每天5%的扣分，再之后提交无效。

"期中考试”计划安排在课程开始后的第7周（具体时间会提前公布），考试内容主要为程序设计相关内容，也通过  http://ica.openjudge.cn/ 网站完成，届时我们将在该平台上设置多道题目，并要求大家在约一周时间内完成。

"期末考试”将在学完全部课程内容之后进行（具体时间也会提前公布），考试形式与期中考试一致。

最终成绩≥85 即可获得优秀证书

courses.certificate_description: This course is about the ethical and political questions that history necessarily poses about the relationship between slavery, capitalism, and democracy in U.S. and world history.

courses.certificate_description: This course explores the relationship between slavery and democracy at the heart of American history. It is about the rise and fall of the slave South from the beginning of the seventeenth century to the end of the American Civil War.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
History of the Slave South offers students a number of learning opportunities in which you can develop historical skills.  At the heart of the course are the discussion boards.  Each week we offer a discussion question that we ask all students to answer.  You can find these questions here.  In addition to these required discussion questions, we have created three essay assignments.  Each of these assignments helps you practice the craft of historical research and analysis.  You can find the instructions for these assignments here.  We ask that you post your essay assignments to the discussion board so that all your peers can learn from your work.  We also ask that you comment on your peers' essay assignments.  You can find instructions for peer reflection here.

In order to earn a Statement of Accomplishment or Verified Certificate, you must score a score a 70-percent in the course.  Answers to the weekly discussion board posts are weighted at 70-percent of the grade and the three essay assignments are weighted at 30-percent of the grade.  Neither the discussion question responses nor the essay assignments are evaluated on an A-F or 0-100 scale.  Instead, so long as you upload your responses in the proper forums, you will receive credit.  We are far more concerned with providing you the prompts, tools, and feedback for meaningful learning than we are about precision in grading in this non-credit course.

In an effort to not penalize those who join this course late, we are allowing students to submit work all the way to the final day of the final week without penalty.  That said, this is as much a community as it is a course, so we have provided you with suggested deadlines (you can find these in the syllabus) and hope to see the majority of you make an effort to keep pace.  If you have any questions about the weekly discussions, please direct them here.  And if you have any questions about the three essay assignments, please direct them here.  Happy learning!

courses.grading_policy_distinction: 本课程的最终成绩由八周的作业成绩和期末考试成绩两部分构成，二者比例为6：4，即平时成绩占最后成绩的60%，期末考试成绩占最后成绩的40%。若最终成绩≥85分，可获得《优秀学业合格证书》。
courses.certificate_description: 《法与社会》属于法社会学的范畴，授课的焦点对准法与社会之间的关系和相互作用。就研究方法而言，法社会学是要在法律中观察和理解社会，在社会中解释和应用法律。就价值根据而言，实证法学以独立的人格、以个人主义为基础，而法社会学以人际关系、以社群主义为基础。就讲义和研讨的内容而言，特别关注的是正式规则与非正式规则之间的互动。这门课程试图以具体的事实、案例、新闻热点为线索来阐述法社会学的基本原理，在政治、经济、道德、历史等不同维度中解读中国的秩序原理。
courses.grading_policy_normal: 本课程的最终成绩由八周的作业成绩和期末考试成绩两部分构成，二者比例为6：4，即平时成绩占最后成绩的60%，期末考试成绩占最后成绩的40%。若最终成绩≥70分，可获得《学业合格证书》。

3.   若最终成绩≥85分，则可获得《优秀学业合格证书》。
courses.certificate_description: 本课程试图和学生一起从思想上重走一遍前辈们走过的路，作一次轻松的数学之旅。在这一旅途中我们不断揭示一些概念和数学思想形成的过程和历史，理解数学抽象的必要性和魅力，真实体会数学抽象所表现出的人类心智的荣耀，潜移默化地从中培养数学抽象的能力。

Grades


The result of the quizzes in the teaching video will not be included in the final grade.

The final grade (100 possible points) consists of two parts. The first part (60 points) comes from the assignments during the six-week course; the second part (40 points) comes from the final exam. As for the scoring of the assignments, each multiple choice question accounts for 0.4 point, while each open question accounts for 2 points. That’s to say, more open questions you answer, more points you’ll get. However, the total score of assignments will not surpass 60 points.

For those with a final grade of more than 70 points, a certificate of competency will be awarded; more than 85 points, a certificate of excellence.

courses.certificate_description: This undergraduate course develops critical thinking and analytic problem-solving skills necessary for general chemistry, and introduces basic principles of quantum theory, chemical bonding, reaction stoichiometry, and thermochemistry.

courses.certificate_description: 人文學，其特色在於「慢熱」，需要耐心細嚐、咀嚼古聖先賢的智慧結晶與其文字背後隱含的真正意義。《史記》不僅記載了無數精彩非凡的歷史人事，更貫串了在它之前的多數古代典籍，可說是集中國上古文明精粹於一書。恭喜你通過了本課程的要求，希望在這一場歷史的思辨之旅後，能夠讓你重新認識中華文明的智慧價值，並對你的學習和人生有所幫助。
courses.grading_policy_normal:
本課程共包含三次作業，每次作業均為二十分。成績結算時將取三次中之二次高分計算，換算為百分制後，學期總分達三十分以上方可取得修業證明。
授課教師保留最後調整成績之權利。

courses.certificate_description: Success today requires us to see leadership and life as pieces of the same puzzle. courses.certificate_description: This course covers behavioral genetic methodologies from twin and adoption studies through DNA analysis and applies them to address longstanding questions about the origins of individual differences in behavioral traits.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
1.本课程的总成绩由平时作业与期末考试两部分构成，各占50%，满分100分。
2.本课程平时作业为九周课程的作业成绩，共90分。包括：每周10道客观题（单项选择题），每题0.5分；5道思考题（互相评分），每题1分。
3.本课程全部完成后，进行期末考试，满分为90分。
4.本课程最终成绩≥70者，即可获得合格证书；最终成绩≥85者，即可获得优秀证书。

考核形式：
1.视频小题（Quizzes）：每周课程视频中，皆包含有若干简单问题，以提升修课同学的兴趣，此类问题考察不计入课程成绩。但须注意的是，须作答完成此类问题后，方能观看后续视频。
2.每周作业（Homework）：每周课程结束后，都包含有15道选择题和简答题，选修学生须在14天内，即在课程上线2周内，完成并网上提交。其中选择题由系统自动批改，简答题将在线上互评。
3.期末考试（Exam）：考试时间为课程最后一周上线后2周内完成，仅有一次答题机会，提交答案后系统自动批改。
courses.certificate_description: 面对生活的全面“媒介化”，我们是否依然向往“小桥流水人家”式的传统社会，还是心甘情愿地投身于现代社会的信息洪流？媒介，究竟如何影响我们的社会、文化和生活，这是需要我们思考和探索的问题。就让我们一起对媒介进行思考、批判和探索吧！

courses.certificate_description: Dieser Grundlagenkurs über das Trauma-Management von verschiedenen Formen von Unfällen behandelt die Frakturversorgung sowie Therapie von Hand- und Weichteilverletzungen und führt in die spannende Welt der Unfallchirurgie ein.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Die Benotung des "Grundlagenkurs Unfallchirurgie" erfolgt über wöchentlich veröffentlichte Quizze über je 2 Episoden (außer in Woche 11, in der nur eine Episode samt passendem Quiz erscheint).

Wöchentliche Quizze (Gewichtung 100%)

Jedes Quiz enthält 8-20 Fragen, und die Teilnehmer haben 7 Tage Zeit, diese zu bearbeiten (Soft Deadline). Zusätzlich wird eine Nachholfrist von 3 weiteren Tagen gewährt (Hard Deadline).

Teilnehmer, die 60% aller Fragen in allen Quizzen richtig beantwortet haben, haben den Kurs erfolgreich absolviert und erhalten ein entsprechendes Zertifikat der Technischen Universität München.

courses.certificate_description: This course explores the challenges neuroscientists face as they work with the data they collect from the brain. Students explore data collected in researchers' labs to gain knowledge of basic principles in neuroscience, programming, and techniques for data analysis.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade for the course is determined as a weighted average of all graded assignments (including homework questions, programming assignments, and peer assessments). Each of the four course units is worth 15% of the final grade, and the final project is worth 40%. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you will need to receive a final score of 65% or higher.

Grading Strategy 

Participants must receive an overall score of 50% or higher, in order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment (SoA). Participants who score 80% or more will receive a special distinction, which will be noted on their SoA. 

Weighting
Week 1 Quiz 				- 20%
Best of any one of the Week3 Quizzes 	- 20%
Play the risk horizon game 		- 10%
Reflection on the risk horizon game 	- 10%
Final Project 				- 40%
Total 					-100%

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The class consists of lecture videos with integrated quiz questions designed to ensure you understand the material covered in the videos.  In recognition that not all participants have the same learning objectives or available time, the course is offered at two levels of engagement. Students who complete the Mastery Track (estimated time commitment: 5 – 7 Hours Per Week) will receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction that certifies mastery of the practice of the course content.  In addition to completing the auto-graded weekly quizzes and final exam from the Standard Track, students in this track will also complete peer-graded short essays and peer-graded programming assignments. The programming assignments will involve writing concurrent and networked software in popular pattern-oriented software architecture frameworks written in Java (such as Android) and C++ (such as ACE and Boost). This track is designed for those students wishing to achieve mastery of the course material and to understand its application in a real-world project context. The final grade for the Mastery Track will be based on the weekly quizzes (50% of the final grade), peer-graded short essays and peer-graded assignments (40% of the final grade) and a final exam (10% of the final grade). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you have to obtain >= 70% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course teaches students how to apply patterns, pattern languages, and frameworks to alleviate the complexity of developing concurrent and networked software.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The class consists of lecture videos with integrated quiz questions designed to ensure you understand the material covered in the videos.  In recognition that not all participants have the same learning objectives or available time, the course is offered at two levels of engagement. Students who complete the Standard Track (estimated time commitment:  3 – 5 Hours Per Week) will receive a Statement of Accomplishment that certifies advanced proficiency with the course concepts, which will be assessed by weekly auto-graded standalone quizzes.  This track is designed for those who wish to engage the material by doing the auto-graded quizzes, final exam, and participating in the online discussion forums, but who may not have the time/interest to complete the peer-graded short essay questions and peer-graded programming assignments. The final grade for the Standard Track will be based on the weekly quizzes (80% of the final grade) and a final exam (20% of the final grade). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
To earn a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction by performing at the highest levels. These include:

•	By earning 30.00-39.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Prebendary (Prebendario) - Novice Paleographer".
•	By earning 40.00-49.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Rationer (Racionero) - Intermediate Paleographer".
•	By earning 50.00-59.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Deacon (Diacono) - Superior Paleographer".
•	By earning 60.00 to 99.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Archdeacon (Arcediano) - Advanced Paleographer".
•	By earning 100.00 points (with extra credit), you are recognized as a "Cathedral Vicar (Vicario) - Highly Advanced Paleographer”.
courses.certificate_description:
The student has:
*Participated as a citizen scholar.
*Discussed the relations of Jews, Christians, and Muslims.
*Applied paleographic methods to transcribe manuscripts.
*Interpreted 19th century transcriptions of cathedral records.
*Performed primary research and analysis.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Updated 25 September 2014 to ensure those persons that completed all historical content quizzes can earn a Statement of Accomplishment (Students can earn this statement without completing the more technically-challenging paleographic quizzes, transcriptions, and peer evaluations) 

Points records below are before we apply "weighting" to each assignment.

Your grade is calculated base on the following criteria:
•	Completion of five (5) quizzes pertaining to historical content (2 points per quiz) = 10 points total.
•	Completion of five (5) quizzes pertaining to paleographical (reading handwriting) skills (5 points per quiz) = 25 points total.
•	Any participation in discussions boards = 5 points total = these points are automatically added to your grade.
•	Completion of three (3) transcription assignments and three (3) peer reviews (20 points per assignment and peer review) = 60 points total.
•	Additionally, extra credit points are awarded for supplemental work performed on transcription assignments (extra transcriptions and additional data interpretation).
A total of 100 points can be earned in this course.

To earn a basic Statement of Accomplishment, you must earn a total of 10 points (in most cases, this requires a student to only complete the historical content quizzes and to participate in discussion boards)

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
To earn a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction by performing at the highest levels. These include:

By earning 30.00-39.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Prebendary (Prebendario) - Novice Paleographer".

By earning 40.00-49.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Rationer (Racionero) - Intermediate Paleographer".

By earning 50.00-59.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Deacon (Diacono) - Superior Paleographer".

By earning 60.00 to 99.99 points, you are recognized as a "Cathedral Archdeacon (Arcediano) - Advanced Paleographer".

By earning 100.00 points (which includes extra credit), you are recognized as a Cathedral Vicar (Vicario) - Highly Advanced Paleographer”.
courses.certificate_description:
The student has:
*Participated as a citizen scholar.

courses.grading_policy_normal:
Your grade is calculated base on the following criteria:

*Completion of four (4) quizzes pertaining to historical content (5 pts per quiz) = 20 points total.

*Completion of six (6) quizzes pertaining to paleographical (reading handwriting) skills (10 points per quiz) = 60 points total.

Updated 25 September 2014 to ensure those persons that completed all historical content quizzes can earn a Statement of Accomplishment (Students can earn this statement without completing the more technically-challenging paleographic quizzes, transcriptions, and peer evaluations) 

Points records below are before we apply "weighting" to each assignment.

Your grade is calculated base on the following criteria:

·       Completion of five (5) quizzes pertaining to historical content (2 points per quiz) = 10 points total.

·       Completion of five (5) quizzes pertaining to paleographical (reading handwriting) skills (5 points per quiz) = 25 points total.

·       Any participation in discussions boards = 5 points total = these points are automatically added to your grade.

·       Completion of three (3) transcription assignments and three (3) peer reviews (20 points per assignment and peer review) = 60 points total.

·       Additionally, extra credit points are awarded for supplemental work performed on transcription assignments (extra transcriptions and additional data interpretation).

A total of 100 points can be earned in this course (+ extra credit points). Extra credit points are calculated, however, Coursera.org only shows a maximum score of 100.

To earn a basic Statement of Accomplishment, you must earn a total of 10 points (in most cases, this requires a student to only complete the historical content quizzes and to participate in discussion boards)

课程评分标准

    本课程的最终成绩由两部分构成，满分为100分。第一部分是课程测验，占50%，第二部分是期末考试，占50%。

    若最终成绩≥70分，则可获得《学业合格证书》；若期末成绩≥85分，则可获得《优秀学业合格证书》。



Course Scoring Criteria


      The final grades for this course are made up of two parts with a maximum score of 100 points. The first part is homework grades, taking up 50%.  The second part is the final exam, which takes 50%.
      You can receive the Academic Certificate of Qualification if the final score is ≥70; if the final score is ≥85, an Outstanding Academic Certificate of Qualification will be given.

本課程含六次隨週測驗、兩次申論題作業與一次期末測驗，隨週測驗皆為選擇題；
申論題每位同學需批改四~五份他人作業。

期末測驗：20%
申論題一：10%(加分題)
申論題二：20%(課程回顧題與延伸續寫題二擇一)

學期總成績達九十五分(含)以上，即可取得傑出修業合格證明。
courses.certificate_description: 本次課程將聚焦於書中的「成熟」女性形象，以「母神」信仰為中心，辨析女媧─警幻─賈母─王夫人─元妃─劉姥姥等六人在書中展現的形象與其象徵意義，進一步理解與「少女」的「嬰兒女神」相對，並更具有守護力量的「母神」之存在。

courses.certificate_description: Using case examples, this interdisciplinary course explored the challenges of genomic and precision medicine, and provided an introduction to ethical, legal, social, and policy issues that arise in the translation of genomic knowledge into medical and public health practice.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on 7 multiple-choice quizzes (10% each, 70% total) and 3 peer-assessed writing assignments (10% each, 30% total). To earn a credential, students were required to achieve a minimum grade of 70%.

courses.certificate_description: This course explores the theory and practice of effective healthcare leadership. It examines current healthcare challenges and reviews the leadership competencies required to meet these challenges within and across healthcare teams and organisations.

courses.certificate_description: Ce cours expose les principaux courants de l’éthique philosophique – eudémonisme, perspective déontologique, utilitarisme et éthique du don - à la fois dans leurs sources historiques, leur actualité et leur portée contemporaine.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
La note finale est basée sur 7 tests d’évaluation (quiz des leçons 1 à 7 comptant pour 60% dans le score final), et sur 1 test d’évaluation de fin de cours (quiz de la leçon 8 portant sur l’ensemble des leçons, comptant pour 40% dans le score final).
Pour obtenir une attestation de réussite (Statement of Accomplishment), vous devez atteindre ≥ 70% du score maximal possible sur l’ensemble des 8 tests.

courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course provides an overview of current challenges and developments within the field of Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights, including issues of primary global importance as well as aspects that are relevant for specific settings and groups.

courses.certificate_description: The course presents concepts and processes of quality improvement (QI) in healthcare systems as well as skills needed to lead and participate in healthcare teams focused on quality improvement.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
In order to complete the course and be eligible for a Statement of Accomplishment, students will be required to complete 90% of modules. 

Completion of individual modules is measured by the following: 
70% on 90% of the module quizzes

Students are expected to do the following:
1. Watch the lecture videos
2. Read the assigned readings for each module
3. Contribute to the discussion board in the following manner:
    a. Personal post to discussion forum based on weekly clinical based component
    b. Commenting on the posts of two other students in the course
4. Complete assignments and peer evaluations.

1.    本课程的最终成绩由三部分构成，满分为100分。第一部分是六周的单元练习成绩，占20%，第二部分是互评作业成绩，占30%，第三部分为期末考试成绩，占50%；

courses.certificate_description: 本课程针对医学图像的特征，结合临床需求，由浅入深地讲解医学图像的种类、特征、应用领域、数字化存储形式，并分类讲解图像处理的理论和算法，结合应用案例和课程实践使学生熟练掌握相关领域的知识和技能，并具备一定的动手能力，为进一步学习医学图像领域的其他课程奠定基础。

courses.certificate_description: This is part 1 of a two part course that will cover the topics on the AP* AB Calculus Exam.  Part 1 will cover limits, continuity, derivatives and applications of derivatives.  Part 2 will cover integration and applications of integration.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
**The final grade for this course will be calculated as follows:

Quizzes/Homework (weighting 50%)

Exams (Weighting: 50%)

This will be a sample of the multiple choice portions of the AP Calculus AB Exam over the topics covered in this part of the course.. Multiple attempts are allowed, and the highest score of all attempts will determine the grade for the final exam. 

The Quizzes/Homework and Final Exam are due by the last day of class. We suggest that you take care of the homework assignments on a weekly basis, so that you will have time to complete everything by the end of the course. Remember, your goal is to get a 5 on the AP exam!


A final grade of 65% will constitute passing.

courses.certificate_description: 本课是法学训练的基础课程。教学内容主要集中于学术研究的基本方法与一般理念，既包括学术论文的提问、选题、谋篇、布局和实际写作，也包括学术资源特别是综合性与专业性数据库的检索和使用。

courses.grading_policy_normal: The evaluation will be adjusted according to different topics and different tasks. Generally, all students can pass by completing all specified assignments. courses.certificate_description: This course will provide learners with an opportunity to explore the challenges, opportunities, and skills necessary to provide nursing care in rural areas.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Students will be assigned a two page paper on each of the following four topic areas:

1 -- Description of a rural or remote area with which they have personal experience, or which they plan to enter to provide nursing care.  This description will cover geographical identification, population details, socio-economic characteristics, and other pertinent location descriptors (i.e., climate, political strife, access to water and food).

2 -- Identification of characteristics that present barriers and opportunities for providing nursing care in the area identified in Assignment #1.

3 -- Description of possible approaches to problem-solving the barriers identified in Assignment #2, incorporating concepts presented in the course.

4 -- The final paper is a more detailed description of a program, policy, or other innovation to improve the health care of a rural population.

courses.certificate_description: This course surveys the law that regulates government surveillance. Material includes the Fourth and Fifth Amendments, the Electronic Communications Privacy Act, the Communications Assistance for Law Enforcement Act, and the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on six quizzes. In order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment, a learner must achieve an average of 70% or higher.

courses.certificate_description: This university-level course provides a broad overview of the science behind water and climate in the Western United States with a survey of the major legal, political, and cultural issues.

courses.certificate_description: Este curso busca estimular os participantes a compreender e refletir sobre organizações e ambiente de negócios, apoiar compreensão de terminologia contábil e seus relatórios básicos e inspirar uma reflexão sobre carreira e desenvolvimento profissional na área.

Learning for Sustainability is learning to live within the environmental limits of our planet and to build a just, equitable and peaceful society.

courses.certificate_description: Este curso visa analisar a relação entre a Contabilidade e a sociedade através do tempo e oferecer um contexto para o conteúdo técnico que os estudantes costumam aprender em cursos de graduação.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Neste curso adotamos várias formas de avaliação dos participantes, até mesmo para que se possa ter uma sinalização mais compreensiva a respeito do desempenho de cada um. Serão adotados: (a) questões de múltipla escolha ao longo dos vídeos (in-video quizzes, sem valor para nota final), (b) testes com questões de múltipla-escolha ao término de cada sessão, (c) preparação de textos (com correção pelos pares) e (d) desempenho no jogo DEBORAH.
O jogo responde por 10% da nota, produção de textos por 40% e os testes por 50%. Para receber a Declaração (Statement of Accoumplishment) o participante deverá obter no mínimo 70% de aproveitamento geral.

courses.certificate_description: This is part 2 of a two part course that will cover the topics on the AP* AB Calculus Exam.  Part 1 covered limits, continuity, derivatives and applications of derivatives.  Part 2 will cover integration and applications of integration.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
**The final grade for this course will be calculated as follows:

Quizzes/Homework (weighting 50%)

Exams (Weighting: 50%)

This will be a sample of the multiple choice portions of the AP Calculus AB Exam over the topics covered in this part of the course.. Multiple attempts are allowed, and the highest score of all attempts will determine the grade for the final exam. 

The Quizzes/Homework and Final Exam are due by the last day of class. We suggest that you take care of the homework assignments on a weekly basis, so that you will have time to complete everything by the end of the course. Remember, your goal is to get a 5 on the AP exam!


A final grade of 65% will constitute passing.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Les étudiants qui ont obtenu une moyenne d'au moins 65/100 sur pour les 8 exercices du cours reçoivent un certificat avec mention.
courses.certificate_description: Ce cours présente les principes du fonctionnement, du dimensionnement et de la conception des structures. L'approche est basée sur une utilisation de la statique graphique et traite des structures en treillis, en poutre, en dalle et en cadre.
courses.grading_policy_normal: Chaque exercice hebdomadaire est corrigé, après quoi l'étudiant peut voir le nombre de points obtenus. Une note sur 100 de zéro (très faible) à 100 (excellent) est attribuée pour chaque exercice. En fin de cours, la somme des notes obtenues lors des exercices est divisée par le nombre d'exercices à faire (8). Tout étudiant qui a obtenu une moyenne de 55/100 reçoit un certificat pour le cours.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
按照以下方式计算分数：

·       共有10次测验。最终计算总分时我们将去掉2个测验最低分（测验成绩不会丢失）。

·       每次测验和考试均有2次机会。取其中的最高分计为有效分数。

·       最终分数为测验平均分和考试（共2次考试）平均分各占50%。

·       及格分为总分的75%。分数达到总分75%的学生均可获得完成证书。如果分数达到总分的90%以上，完成证书上会标有“优异”字样。

·       每次测验和考试均有2次机会。取其中的最高分计为有效分数。

·       最终分数为测验平均分和考试（共2次考试）平均分各占50%。

·       及格分为总分的75%。分数达到总分75%的学生均可获得完成证书。如果分数达到总分的90%以上，完成证书上会标有“优异”字样。

courses.certificate_description: This course provides theoretical and practical training for epidemiologists, physicians and professionals of related disciplines in statistical modeling with particular emphasis on linear and multiple regression.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
We will offer a standard Statement of Accomplishment to students who earn a minimum of 85% of the total possible points from the quiz scores. This statement does not indicate that a student has developed understanding or mastery in regression analysis, but rather that a student has passed the quizzes. 

We do not consider the quiz scores in this course as an indicator of successful development of understanding and applicable skill in regression analysis.

courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course teaches students how to apply patterns and frameworks to alleviate the complexity of developing concurrent and networked services on mobile devices running Android that connect to popular cloud computing platforms.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
In addition to completing the auto-graded weekly quizzes, students will also complete auto-/peer-graded programming assignments. These programming assignments will involve writing concurrent Android applications using its pattern-oriented frameworks written in Java. The final grade for the course will be calculated as follows:

    Weekly quizzes (Weighting: 30%)

    Each quiz will contain a number of equally-weighted questions. You will have until noon central time on the last day of the class to submit the quiz.  There will be ~4 quizzes.

    Programming assignments (Weighting: 70%)

    You will have N programming assignments (where N == ~3) by the end of the course. You will have roughly 14 days to submit your solution. The total weekly assignment score will be 70% of the final course score for students. Each assignment will account for 1/Nth of the total programming assignment points, so it's possible to miss an assignment and still pass the class as long as you do well on the other assignments.  

To receive a Verified Certificate students will need to score at least 70% on their final grade (which combines the weekly quizzes and programming assignments).

courses.certificate_description: This MOOC describes by example how to connect Android mobile devices to clouds via the use of Java programming language features, Jetty middleware, Java Servlets, the Java Spring Framework, and cloud computing platforms, such as Google App Engine.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Coursera offers the Signature Track, which verifies the identity of students. Students in the Signature Track can receive a Verified Certificate if they meet the criteria described below.  It's  mandatory for students in the Signature Track to successfully achieve a Verified Certificate in all MOOCs in the MoCCA Specialization to take the Capstone project at the end of the Specialization. 

The MobileCloud MOOC is the fifth course in the Mobile Cloud Computing with Android (MoCCA) Specialization. It consists of lecture videos with integrated quiz questions designed to ensure students understand the material covered in the videos.  The estimated time commitment is roughly 8 – 12 hours per week, depending on background and interest level. In addition to completing the auto-graded weekly quizzes, students will also complete auto-/peer-graded programming assignments. These programming assignments will involve writing secure Android and Spring applications using its pattern-oriented frameworks written in Java. The final grade for the course will be calculated as follows:

Weekly quizzes (Weighting: 30%)

Each quiz will contain a number of equally-weighted questions. You will have until noon central time on the last day of the class to submit the quiz.  There will be ~4 quizzes.

Programming assignments (Weighting: 70%)

You will have N programming assignments (where N == ~3) by the end of the course. You will have roughly 14 days to submit your solution. The total weekly assignment score will be 70% of the final course score for students. Each assignment will account for 1/Nth of the total programming assignment points, so it's possible to miss an assignment and still pass the class as long as you do well on the other assignments.
