courses.certificate_description: Focus on various bioinformatics methods of analysis including: unsupervised clustering, gene-set enrichment analyses, network visualization and supervised machine learning applications to LINCS data and other relevant big data from molecular biomedicine.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on the midterm exam (40% of the final grade) and the final exam (60% of the final grade). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 70% of the maximum possible score."

courses.certificate_description: This graduate course is an introduction to the application of quantum mechanics to light, including light-matter interaction and non-classical states of light.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The grading is based on assignments (70%) and a final exam (30%) .

courses.grading_policy_distinction: To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you must obtain at least 90% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: In this course, students will develop a promising business opportunity into a venture concept proposal, and launch it in real life. They will gain an overview of key steps in the venture creation process, including marketing and fundraising.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
The class consists of lecture videos, between 10 and 45 minutes in length, to be watched weekly.  Your grade in this course is based on Quizzes (45%), a Final Project (51%), and your Course Engagement (4% ; measured by participation in discussion fora).  

To receive credit for the course and be eligible for one of the seed-funding prizes, you must complete the quizzes and assignments before the indicated deadlines. 

To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you must obtain at least 60% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: In this course, students will develop a promising business opportunity into a venture concept proposal, and launch it in a crowdfunding platform. They will gain an overview of key steps in the venture creation process, including marketing and fundraising.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
The class consists of lecture videos, between 10 and 45 minutes in length, to be watched weekly.  Your grade in this course is based on Online presence (online discussions + quizzes: 12.5%), Final Project (50%), Classroom contribution in our EPFL sessions (12.5%) and your Crowdfunding Exercise (25%).

If you have already completed the MOOC in the prior version, let Chris Tucci know and we will figure out an evaluation plan for you.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Your final grade will be a combination of a peer assessment plan that you complete and your assessment of 2 students' peer assessments (50%), forum participation (worth 35%, with 12 posts/comments needed for full credit), and two course surveys (7.5% each, full credit granted upon submission). To earn a Statement of Accomplishment you much achieve an overall class grade of at least 75%. An overall class grade of 90% or higher will earn a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction.
courses.certificate_description: This course for teachers introduced tools from the Literacy Design Collaborative, incorporating Common Core Literacy standards to develop a plan to use in a classroom setting.
courses.grading_policy_normal: Your final grade will be a combination of a peer assessment plan that you complete and your assessment of 2 students' peer assessments (50%), forum participation (worth 35%, with 12 posts/comments needed for full credit), and two course surveys (7.5% each, full credit granted upon submission). To earn a Statement of Accomplishment you much achieve an overall class grade of at least 75%.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: Pour obtenir le certificat "avec mention", il faut avoir obtenu à l'ensemble des trois examens plus de 80 % du score maximum possible.
courses.certificate_description: Ce cours de l'École normale supérieure (ENS) de Paris est une introduction au droit international et au droit comparé qui présente les grandes problématiques au cœur de l'analyse des ordres juridiques contemporains.
courses.grading_policy_normal: Le certificat est délivré à la suite de trois examens, sous forme de questions, intervenant après des groupes de cinq thèmes traités dans le cours (il y en a 15 en tout). L'obtention du certificat requiert un score global de 70 %.

To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you must earn a grade of at least 85% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: Space is a basic category of human thought. In this course, we explored various categories of space in the field of Old Norse culture. With guest scholars from different fields we discussed how space is conceptualized and depicted in diverse Old Norse genres and traditions.

courses.grading_policy_distinction:
Grading Strategy for Policy and Practise Track

Participants must receive an overall score of 80% or higher in order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment (SoA). Your SoA will have a special distinction mark as you have chosen the Policy and Practise Track.

Weighting

Quiz 1 – 15%
Quiz 2 – 15%
Quiz 3 – 15%
Opinion Piece Peer Assessment – 20%
Final Project – 35%
Total – 100%
courses.certificate_description: Governments around the world, especially in developing countries, struggle to develop and maintain infrastructure that supports national and economic growth and delivers basic services. This course outlined the role of PPPs in the delivery of infrastructure services.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
Grading Strategy for Awareness Track

Participants must receive an overall score of 80% or higher in order to receive a Statement of Accomplishment (SoA). 

Weighting

Quiz 1 – 25%
Quiz 2 – 25%
Quiz 3 – 25%
Quiz 4 – 25%
Total – 100%

courses.certificate_description: The course includes an introduction to learning analytics, followed by an array of five different topics and opportunities to analyze realistic data and create new code for analysis or visualization.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on an peer-graded writing assignment and an exam.  To receive the certificate, you have to obtain >= 70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description:
“算法设计与分析”是计算机科学与技术专业的一门核心课程。通过学习算法不但对其他专业课奠定了扎实的基础，也对培养学生的计算思维和求解问题的能力起到重要的作用。
      本课程首先介绍一些基础知识，然后阐述经典的算法设计思想和分析技术，主要涉及分治策略、动态规划、贪心法、回溯与分支限界等。
courses.grading_policy_normal:
课程成绩将根据平时小测验成绩和最后的课程笔试综合评定。小测验安排10次，每周1次。10次小测验成绩合计占课程成绩的40%，最后的笔试成绩占课程成绩的60%。
      总分达到60分的可以得到证书。

courses.certificate_description: This introductory course focuses on how to address the main challenges of communication in humanitarian settings and how to implement a communication plan in the midst of humanitarian action.
courses.grading_policy_normal:
The final grade is based on:
- 3 assignments (each 25% of the final grade) you will have to complete during the first four weeks of the course. Each assignment is a quiz composed of a series of multiple choices questions.
- A final assignment (25% of the final grade). Your grade will be based on the quality of the assignment you submit for peer review and the three peer reviews you will have to do. 

To receive a Statement of Accomplishment you have to obtain a final grade equal to or above 70% of the maximum possible score.

The final grade is determined by:
- Your best result for each of the three first quizzes (25% each). You have the possibility to do each of the quizzes twice,
- Your grade for the final assignment (25%), assuming you have peer-graded a minimum of 3 other works.

courses.certificate_description: 東坡詞如秋夜的星光、月色，既遙遠又親近。我們以愉悅的心情展讀《東坡詞》，徜徉於〈水調歌頭〉、〈江城子〉、〈定風波〉與〈念奴嬌〉等作品裡，如晤故人，自能心領神會，除了可以看見天才駕馭技巧的藝術表現，更可貼近東坡的內在世界，親切感受一個偉大心靈的躍動，以豐富我們的生命境界，讓我們知曉如何在人情世界中尋得心靈的安頓。
courses.grading_policy_normal: 三次作業成績換算為百分制：第一次作業佔總成績30%，第二次作業佔總成績35%，第三次作業佔總成績35%；凡總成績超過60分者，可得到「認證證書（Signature Track Verifies Certificate）」。

courses.certificate_description: A three week introductory course explaining the UK voting system and political issues, taught during the 2015 election campaign and afterwards in response to real events, through video, forum interaction, quizzes and open resources.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The grade is awarded on the basis of the three weekly quizzes, and in order to pass a learner must obtain at least 50% of the available marks by the end of the course.

courses.certificate_description: The United States has always been a source of fascination — both attraction and repulsion —   "America Through Foreign Eyes" is a rich, interdisciplinary, international course focused on perceptions of America abroad.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on 5 quizzes, worth 60%, and 13 contributions to all of the graded forums, worth 40%.  Achieving a final grade of 75% or higher allows you to pass the course.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade is based on your top three submitted assignments, each worth 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >=90% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: This course provides an overview of the history and structure of the US health care system, including the history of and problems with employment-based health insurance and the challenges surrounding access, cost, and quality.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade is based on your top three submitted assignments, each worth 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >=70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade is based on your top 5 assignments, each of which is 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you must obtain >=90% of the maximum possible score.
courses.certificate_description: This course delineates the specific ways the Affordable Care Act improves access and quality and will control costs. It also explores predictions about the future of health care in America.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade is based on your top 5 assignments, each of which is 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >=70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade is based on your top 5 assignments, each of which is 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction, you must obtain >=80% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade is based on your top 5 assignments, each of which is 10 points. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >=70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: This course gives an evidence-based overview of the physiological, psychological and socioeconomic influences on food choice and obesity.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final mark is based on five assessed quizzes (50% of the final mark) and a piece of reflective peer-assessed work (50% of the final mark). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 50% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: In this course, participants acquired foundational knowledge in the health care management of victims of disasters and public health emergencies, as well as new strategies for increasing hospital surge capacity.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on 4 knowledge quizzes at 15% each and 2 case-study quizzes at 20% each. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, students much obtain >= 70% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: Communication is central to human experience. For those who are born deaf this is the area most at risk. Unless you have personal experience of deafness in your work or a family member who is deaf you may never have thought about this topic.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on five quiz assignments (50% of final grade), a final, peer-reviewed, reflective assignment (30%) and the review of three reflections submitted by others (20%). A Statement of Accomplishment is awarded for a final grade of at least 50%.

courses.certificate_description: An introduction to the processes, people and images associated with early photography,  focusing on specific images and techniques, ranging from high end studio portraiture, iconic landscapes and cityscapes, and the rise of itinerant and beach photography for the masses.
courses.grading_policy_normal: An overall grade of at least 50% was required to pass the course. The course grade was based on four multiple choice quizzes (worth 60%) and a peer assessed written exercise (worth 40%). These required learners to examine Victorian photographic images from the course, to identify key characteristics about them, and to discuss their context in the history of photography.

courses.certificate_description: This course provides a general introduction to the history of ancient Egypt, based on six key items selected from the collections of The Manchester Museum.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was calculated from eight assessed items, each contributing 12.5% to the overall grade. These items were: the highest score achieved in each of the six weekly tests, submitting an assignment, and the evaluation of three assignments in the peer review exercise. To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to have obtained at least 50% of the maximum possible score.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade was based on 5 weekly quizzes (a total of 40 points), four short ‘to-do’ assignments (a total of 40 points) and a final reflection assignment (a total of 20 points). To achieve a distinction, you have to obtain >= 80% of the maximum possible score. You will also have had the chance to receive an extra 8 bonus points if you completed the bonus survey questions in modules 1-4.

Module 3 - Brand leadership & alignment

courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on 5 weekly quizzes (a total of 40 points), four short ‘to-do’ assignments (a total of 40 points) and a final reflection assignment (a total of 20 points). To pass the course, you have to obtain >= 60% of the maximum possible score. You will also have had the chance to receive an extra 8 bonus points if you completed the bonus survey questions in modules 1-4.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: The final grade was based on six quiz assignments each worth 10% of the final grade, plus two peer assessments, each worth 20%. A Distinction is awarded for a final grade of at least 90%.
courses.certificate_description: This course provides an overview of this exciting new world of 2-dimensional materials, including Graphene. It covers what a 2-dimensional material is, how they are produced, their unique and superlative properties, and the range of potential applications.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade was based on six quiz assignments each worth 10% of the final grade, plus two peer assessments, each worth 20%. A Pass is awarded for a final grade of at least 60%.

This course summarizes recent advances in Chinese history and Chinese social science based on the discovery and analysis of new historical data and presents this knowledge in comparative perspective.
courses.grading_policy_normal: All together there are 3 weekly quizzes (60% of the final grade) and 1 final exam (40% of the final grade). To qualify for an e-Statement of Accomplishment, you must get a pass of 60% in the final grade.

courses.certificate_description: This year the international community agreed on a new set of comprehensive and universal development goals. This course examines the main sources of development finance available and the challenge of sourcing, mobilizing and leveraging them to meet global development needs.

courses.certificate_description: 本課程以引導學生進入孟子與中華文化的思想世界，與孟子「對話」，從《孟子》原典中汲取智慧的靈感，以作為在現代社會中立身處世的資糧。

courses.certificate_description: This advanced undergraduate course starts with one week on global trends, has two weeks on environmental management issues and two weeks on environmental technologies around the world.
courses.grading_policy_normal: The final grade is based on 3 peer assessed deliveries (60% of the final grade) and weekly multible choice exam (40% of the final grade). To receive a Statement of Accomplishment, you have to obtain >= 60% of the maximum possible score.

courses.certificate_description: 本课程为面向中学生的零基础大学先修课。课程内容为依托C++讲授C语言程序设计,即讲授C++语言中除面向对象特性以外的部分（与C语言重叠的部分）、C++ STL中最常用的用于排序和查找的算法和容器，以及简单排序，顺序查找、二分、递归初步等基础编程思想。

courses.certificate_description: All political and legal institutions are built on foundational ideas.  In this course, we will explore those ideas, taking the political institutions and political systems around us not as fixed and unquestionable, but as things to evaluate and, if necessary, to change.
courses.grading_policy_normal: To earn an a Statement of Accomplishment you must contribute a post to each of the four weekly required discussion question forums.

courses.grading_policy_distinction: There will be 1-2 quiz questions per video lecture and one integrated quiz at the end of each week. These quiz scores will be used for grading. There will be no other exam or homework. You have to obtain >= 90% of the maximum possible score to receive a Statement of Accomplishment with Distinction.
